text: Constitutive activation of NF-kappaB in primary adult T-cell leukemia cells .
Human T-cell leukemia virus type I ( HTLV-I ) is an etiologic agent of adult T-cell leukemia ( ATL ) .

The viral protein <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces the activation and nuclear translocalization of transcription factor NF-kappaB , which is proposed to play a crucial role in the transformation of T cells by HTLV-I .
However , the HTLV-I genes including <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are not expressed significantly in primary leukemic cells from ATL patients .
In this study , we examined the basis for NF-kappaB activation in freshly isolated leukemic cells from ATL patients .

We found that leukemic cells from ATL patients , like HTLV-I-infected T-cell lines , display constitutive NF-kappaB DNA binding activity and increased degradation of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( an inhibitor of NF-kappaB ) .

text: Whereas the NF-kappaB binding activity in <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - expressing T-cell lines consisted mostly of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , fresh ATL samples contained <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> heterodimers .

One T-cell line derived from ATL leukemic cells , TL-Om1 , displayed constitutive NF-kappaB activity , as well as enhanced degradation of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , despite the lack of detectable <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

text: Interestingly , the NF-kappaB in TL-Om1 consists of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> like that in fresh primary leukemic cells .

Our results suggest that activation of NF-kappaB occurs through a <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent mechanism in leukemic cells of ATL patients , possibly due to differential NF-kappaB subunit activation .
